paper_abstract: A graph G is said to be an (l, d)-graph (with respect to edges) if d(G - E) <= d, VE subset of E(G) such that vertical bar E vertical bar <= l - 1. The l-diameter-stable graphs are (l, d)-graphs with diameter d. In this paper some results given by Hartman and Rubin in [1] and a theorem obtained in [6] are extended. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Some extended results on diameter-stable graphs
